column1: According to Alex. Guillaumot the apparatus consisted of a sort of railway on which the car was moved by manual labor. In the car
column2: which was decorated with the royal colors
column3: are seen seated the ladies and children of the king's household
column4: while the king himself stands in the rear and seems to be directing operations. The remarkable peculiarity to which we would direct the attention of the reader is that this document shows that the car ran on rails very nearly like those used on the railways of the present time
column5: and that a turn-table served for changing the direction to a right angle in order to place the car under the shelter of a small building. The picture which we reproduce
column6: and the authenticity of which is certain
column7: proves then that in the time of Louis XIV. our present railway turn-tables had been thought of and constructed--which is a historic fact worthy of being noted.
